conclusion: Understand the setup of the problem with a point light source, small ball, and initial conditions.
Determine the vertical position of the ball as a function of time using the equation of motion.
The shadow of the ball is formed on the right wall due to the point light source.
Relate the ball's position to the shadow's position using similar triangles.
Solve for the position of the shadow on the wall.
Differentiate the shadow's position to find the velocity of the shadow.
Substitute the derivatives into the equation to find the velocity of the shadow.
Calculate the initial velocity of the shadow at time t = 0.
